Both Shibuya Gaigosai Japanese Language School and Tokyo Japanese Language School (TJLS) offer trial lessons or consultations for prospective students. This is a great way to get a feel for their teaching style, meet the instructors, and ask questions before committing to a course.

**Shibuya Gaigosai Japanese Language School**:

* They offer a free trial lesson (60 minutes) for prospective students. You can attend a regular class and participate in the lesson to get a sense of their teaching style and methodology.
* To schedule a trial lesson, simply contact them through their website or call them at 03-3463-1311. They'll ask for your availability and schedule a trial lesson that fits your schedule.

**Tokyo Japanese Language School (TJLS)**:

* They offer a free consultation (30 minutes) with one of their instructors. This is a one-on-one meeting where you can discuss your goals, current level, and any questions you may have about their courses.
* To schedule a consultation, you can fill out their inquiry form on their website or call them at 03-3468-1177. They'll schedule a consultation at a time that suits you.

During the trial lesson or consultation, you can ask questions like:

* What's the typical class size and structure?
* What's the teaching style and methodology?
* How do they assess student progress and provide feedback?
* Are there any cultural activities or events organized for students?
* What kind of support do they offer for students who need extra help or have questions outside of class?

Take advantage of these trial lessons or consultations to get a feel for the school's atmosphere and teaching style. This will help you make an informed decision about which school is the best fit for you. Good luck!
